published yesterday

The Kitchn received compensation for this post, which was written and edited independently by our editorial team.

I live in Boston, where one of the most talked-about meals is the Fenway Frank, a very regular, steamed hot dog in a bun. Honestly, it’s underwhelming. You know what is worth the trip to the ballpark? The sausage — or, as it’s proudly called, “street meat.” 

I like mine loaded with peppers and onions. Some fans go plain. It’s not every day I attend a baseball game at Fenway, so I’ve been searching for a link that could recreate that same satisfying bite at home. Rastelli’s Provolone and Parsley Pork Sausage Links bring that ballpark flavor to my kitchen. Better yet, because I’m at home, I can think outside the bun. (They’re just as delicious tossed with pasta.)

What You Should Know About Rastelli’s Provolone and Parsley Pork Sausage Links

Rastelli’s started as a small butcher shop in New Jersey and has become one of QVC’s top sellers for meat and seafood. A favorite of The Kitchn team, the brand offers a ton of delicious options like savory ribs, flavorful steak, salmon filets, and more. If you’re a fan of sausage, the Provolone and Parsley Pork Links are a must-try.

They’re made from pork that’s blended with provolone cheese and fresh parsley, and stuffed into natural hog casing. At $24.25 per pound (or less if you catch them on sale!), you get a whopping four pounds of sausages delivered right to your door in about two days. It’s almost too easy.

My Honest Review of Rastelli’s Provolone & Parsley Pork Sausage Links

It was love at first bite with Rastelli’s Provolone and Parsley Pork Sausage Links. The pork was meaty, rich, and fresh, with way more flavor and none of the blandness I often find with the packaged supermarket options.  The provolone cheese adds a creamy, slightly tangy kick with the parsley bringing a fresh, herbal pop in every bite. Honestly, I could eat these sausages on their own. I even made my best friend try them, and she was pleasantly surprised, too! 

Buy: Rastelli’s Provolone and Parsley Pork Sausage Links, $97 for 4 (1-pound) packs at QVC
